text:
Would it be possible to have a “Google search” but searching only Julia manuals, package documentations, blog posts, and discussion forums?
Then I could search for “create array string” or “select rows dataframe” or “parallel for loop”.

elements.text:
Would it be possible to have a “Google search” but searching only Julia manuals, package documentations, blog posts, and discussion forums?
Then I could search for “create array string” or “select rows dataframe” or “parallel for loop”.

text: just add `site:<http://docs.julialang.org|docs.julialang.org>` (or `site:<http://julialang.org|julialang.org>`) to your search?

elements.text: just add
site:docs.julialang.org
(or
site:julialang.org
) to your search?

text: <http://juliahub.com|juliahub.com> will do the former two (julia manual + packages)

elements.text: juliahub.com
will do the former two (julia manual + packages)

text: “jl” is a pretty good search term for anything julia

elements.text: “jl” is a pretty good search term for anything julia

text: Ah, there’s a doc search.

elements.text: Ah, there’s a doc search.

text: There doesn’t seem to be any code that does `Vector{String}`. :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: There doesn’t seem to be any code that does
Vector{String}

text: looks like the code search isn’t handling that right

elements.text: looks like the code search isn’t handling that right

text: <https://juliahub.com/ui/RepoSearch?q=Vector%7BString%7D>
:open_mouth:
That was fast. You did it before I got to ask. :joy:

elements.text: That was fast. You did it before I got to ask.

text: Somehow I never tried those.

elements.text: Somehow I never tried those.

text: juliahub has been my go-to for a while.  It is really nice, but I wish there were a more sophisticated package search.  For example, today I was looking for a good time series package, and I think ultimately what I was looking for was [StateSpaceModels.jl](<https://github.com/LAMPSPUC/StateSpaceModels.jl>), but this was pretty far down in the [search list](<https://juliahub.com/ui/Packages?q=time%20series>) so I didn't find it until someone pointed it out to me

elements.text: juliahub has been my go-to for a while.  It is really nice, but I wish there were a more sophisticated package search.  For example, today I was looking for a good time series package, and I think ultimately what I was looking for was [StateSpaceModels.jl](
), but this was pretty far down in the [search list](
) so I didn't find it until someone pointed it out to me

text: Sounds like you're looking like a Julia version of <https://rseek.org/>

elements.text: Sounds like you're looking like a Julia version of

text: <@U6740K1SP> Who is the "us" that want to know about such examples? I have a one maybe worth reporting: when searching for simulated annealing `Optim.jl` does not show up despite implementing it, which lead me to believe there was no implementation in julia (I subsequently hijacked the name `SimulatedAnnealing` in the general registry with my own small implementation that I never used since I started working on other things ^^')

elements.text: Who is the "us" that want to know about such examples? I have a one maybe worth reporting: when searching for simulated annealing
Optim.jl
does not show up despite implementing it, which lead me to believe there was no implementation in julia (I subsequently hijacked the name
SimulatedAnnealing
in the general registry with my own small implementation that I never used since I started working on other things ^^')
